p: For compound 1a, the 1H NMR spectral value obtained a sharp singlet at δ 9.20 for NH proton and a singlet at δ 4.16 for -CH- proton, 13C NMR spectral values at δ 167.2 and δ 154.0 ppm corresponding to C=O and C=N carbons, respectively. The IR absorption bands show that compound 1b frequency ranges between 3239 and 3246 and 2584 and 2596 cm −1 corresponding to the NH and C=N groups, respectively. For compound 1b, 1H NMR spectral value obtained a sharp singlet at δ 9.34 for NH proton and a singlet at δ 4.12 for -CH- proton, 13C NMR spectra of compound peaks at δ 167.0 and δ154.8 ppm corresponding to C=O and C=N carbons, respectively.
